name: Radar Chart
description: Attempting to replicate radar charts featured in a statistical atlas of yore. The chart pictured here is all the folks who died of scarlet fever in the cities - in 1890. June was a bad month for the fever.

name: Projection Faces
description: A slight riff on the nice Projection Face tool from Andy Woodruff. Here, I just wanted to see all the faces mashed together - small multiples style.

name: Color Fingerprints
description: Fun animation of stacked bar charts. Need I say more? In this animation, each bar is an individual. The color of the garments they have purchased contribute to the colors in the stack. The data is color!

name: Employee Timeline
description: Little timeline of when my co-workers started their employment. Meant to show that it takes an island. Wonderful illustration work by Erin Shellman. Used for a few presentations.

name: Idealize
description: Visualizing Ideals (a math thing. Not a philosophical one). Source code on github. The idea is that this could integrate with more popular tools in this domain for visualization and interaction.

name: Pulsing Map
description: Bubbles invading the U.S.! Run! Actually, just some event data over time. Every blip is a purchase. The shops grow over time as more purchases happen there. The virus will spread over the entire continent if we don't stop it.

name: Funnel Tree
description: Kind of like a conversion funnel - but with a bit more structure, and some branching. A funnel tree! This was meant to show the success and failure rate of some A/B testing.

name: TreeMaps
description: TreeMaps from the 1870s! Can you believe this graphic was used in the 1870 Statistical Atlas? It looks pretty modern to me (apart from the colors and data, of course).

name: State Rankings
description: Politico Magazine ranked all the states based on a number of metrics. I thought it might be fun to try to explore some of them using parallel coordinates. Results are inconclusive.
